intro: Edwardsia mollis, commonly known as the slender sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found growing in saline environments. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to withstand coastal conditions. Edwardsia mollis is also known for its ability to tolerate salt spray and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
